âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Controls mouse pointer with keyboard â€¢ Supports multiple modes: floating, tile, bisect, split, and click â€¢ Floating mode supports auto-detection of areas using OpenCV
ðŸ“– Summary: The wl-kbptr utility enables users to control the mouse pointer with the keyboard on Wayland. It offers various modes like floating, tile, bisect, split, and click for precise pointer control. The floating mode can automatically detect target areas using OpenCV, and it supports compositors implementing the wlr-layer-shell-unstable-v1 and wlr-virtual-pointer-unstable-v1 protocols.
